message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.RO, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the development of a hybrid imaging system that uses a learning-based approach to generate light field videos from a combination of a 3 fps light field sequence and a standard 30 fps 2D video. The paper involves computer vision techniques such as spatio-temporal flow estimation and appearance estimation, which are commonly used in the field of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also deals with graphics and visualization (cs.GR) as it involves generating parallax view generation and refocusing on videos. The paper involves machine learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks (cs.MM) and the development of a hybrid imaging system that combines two different types of cameras (cs.RO). Finally, the paper involves the development of a new algorithm that outperforms current video interpolation methods (cs.AI).
